info.title: MaintenanceManagerPlugin
info.description: The `MaintenanceManager` plugin allows you to control and monitor maintenance activities on set-top devices.

getMaintenanceActivityStatus.summary:
Gets the maintenance activity status details.  
**Maintenance Statuses**  
* `MAINTENANCE_IDLE` - Sent when the Maintenance service is not executing any activities and until the first maintenance task is started  
* `MAINTENANCE_STARTED` - Sent immediately on maintenance startup either scheduled or on boot  
* `MAINTENANCE_ERROR` - Sent after receiving error notification while executing any of the maintenance activities  
* `MAINTENANCE_COMPLETE` - Sent after receiving `*_COMPLETE` notification from all critical maintenance tasks  
* `MAINTENANCE_INCOMPLETE` - Sent whenever the Maintenance service doesn't execute one or more of the tasks. `MAINTENANCE_ERROR` is returned even if only one task returns error. 
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

LastSuccessfulCompletionTime.summary: The time the last maintenance completed or `0` if not applicable

isCriticalMaintenance.summary: `true` if the maintenance activity cannot be aborted, otherwise `false`

isRebootPending.summary: `true` if the device is going to reboot, otherwise `false`

getMaintenanceStartTime.summary:
Gets the scheduled maintenance start time. 
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

setMaintenanceMode.summary:
Sets the maintenance mode. 
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

maintenanceMode.summary: The maintenance mode. The `FOREGROUND` mode runs all maintenance tasks. The `BACKGROUND` mode runs maintenance tasks that do not impact the user experience. If the mode is not set then, it returns `SysSrv Status` and `errorMessage`

startMaintenance.summary:
Starts maintenance activities. 
 
### Events 
| Event | Description | 
| :----------- | :----------- |
| `onMaintenanceStatusChange` | Triggers when the maintenance status changed to `MAINTENANCE_STARTED` |.

stopMaintenance.summary:
Stops maintenance activities. 
 
### Events 
| Event | Description | 
| :----------- | :----------- |
| `onMaintenanceStatusChange` | Triggers when the maintenance status changed to `MAINTENANCE_ERROR` |.

onMaintenanceStatusChange.summary: Triggered when the maintenance manager status changes. See `getMaintenanceActivityStatus` for a list of statuses.
